Title(s): ‘Liber qui vocatur Anglice Mayster Jon Gardener’
_description: A Poem on Gardening, ‘Liber qui vocatur Anglice Mayster Jon Gardener’ — 196 lines in couplets

CamTCC1450.First Lines:
ho so wyl a gardener behere he may both hyre &
                    se…
CamTCC1450.Last Lines:
…Three ynchys depe they most sette beAnd thus seyde
                        mas mayster Ion gardener to me
CamTCC1450.Note:
A nineteenth-century transcript is London,  British Library Addit. 20091, ff.
                    75-8.
CamTCC1450.Attributed Title:
Explicit hic Liber qui vocatur Anglice Mayster Ion Gardener (f.
                        20v)
CamTCC1450.Editions:
Tyssen-Amherst,  Alicia M. 
             “On a Fifteenth Century Treatise on Gardening by ‘Mayster’
                John Gardener.” 
             Archaeologia
         54 (1888): 157-72: 157-72.
